intro: Ouratea reticulata var. turnerae, commonly known as Turnera's ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded forest environments. Its ornamental value is due to its attractive leaves and prolonged flowering period.
